title: Kawhi Leonard gets random drug test right after making his MVP case vs Rockets
text:
Mar 7, 2017 at 6:22a ET 0Shares 
Kawhi Leonard stated his case for MVP on Monday night with some last-minute heroics in a thrilling win over James Harden and the Houston Rockets. 
But before he could come out to discuss it in the postgame press conference, the San Antonio Spurs star had some pressing business to take care of. Namely, he had to take a random drug test, one of four NBA players receive during each season. NBA selected Kawhi Leonard for random drug test. So he's in the back waiting until he can produce a specimen. 
— Michael C. Wright (@mikecwright) March 7, 2017 
Granted, this seems like standard business in the NBA, but the timing sure seems convenient. 
Former NFL punter Pat McAfee knows the feeling . So does James Harrison. 
Still, we’re just glad to see Leonard getting some MVP hype, a cause our own Skip Bayless can surely get behind. KAWHI LEONARD DOES IT AGAIN. OUTPLAYS HARDEN IN 4TH QUARTER. SPURS HAVE GONE FROM BIG 3 TO BIG 1: KAWHI LEONARD. 
— Skip Bayless (@RealSkipBayless) March 7, 2017 I said on Undisputed this morning that Kawhi is now more dominant than LeBron. He just proved it against Harden and the hot Rockets. UNREAL. 
— Skip Bayless (@RealSkipBayless) March 7, 2017 No more dominating and clutch 4th-quarter player in the NBA – on defense as well as offense – than Kawhi. Late 3 then chase-down of Harden! 
— Skip Bayless (@RealSkipBayless) March 7, 2017 0
